    • Simple example of basic PvSTATEM package pre-release version functionalities

    Simple example of basic PvSTATEM package pre-release version functionalities

    Tymoteusz Kwieciński

    2024-07-08

    example_script.Rmd

    Introduction

    The basic functionality of the PvSTATEM package is reading raw MBA data. To present the functionalities of the package, we created a simple, artificial csv file, which is pre-loaded into the package.

    library(PvSTATEM)

plate_filepath <- system.file("extdata", "random.csv", package = "PvSTATEM", mustWork = TRUE) # get the filepath of the csv dataset


plate <- read_data(plate_filepath) # read the data
    #> Reading MBA plate csv file...
#> 
#> (NOTE)
#> CRC block found, omiting it for now
#> New plate object has been created!
#> 
#> Running consistency checks...
#> (WARNING)
#> Plate contains at least one region that did not reach the specified bead count - 50

    After the plate is successfully loaded, we can look into some basic information about the plate.

    plate$summary()
    #> Summary of the plate generated on 01/07/2024 00:00
#> with name 'random':
#> Total number of samples: 8
#> Number of blank samples: 1
#> Number of positive control samples: 4
#> Number of negative control samples: 0
    plate$get_sample(1)
    #> A sample BLANK with ID:  1 
#> Sample Type:  BLANK 
#> Sample Location:  (A, 1)
    plate$get_sample_by_type("POSITIVE CONTROL")[[1]]
    #> A sample CP3 1/50 with ID:  5 
#> Sample Type:  POSITIVE CONTROL 
#> Dilution Factor:  1/50 
#> Sample Location:  (B, 1)
    plate$sample_names
    #> [1] "BLANK"      "test1"      "test2"      "test3"      "CP3 1/50"  
#> [6] "CP3 1/250"  "CP3 1/1250" "CP3 1/6250"
    plate$analyte_names
    #> [1] "Etramp5_ag1" "Etramp4_ag1" "AMA1"

    Warnings

    Our scripts are designed to catch potential errors in the data. If there are any warnings, they will be stored in the warnings field of the plate object. The warnings can be accessed by the $warnings field of the plate object or by the $warnings field of the sample object.

    ## warnings ----------------------------------------------------------------

plate$warnings
    #> [[1]]
#> [[1]][[1]]
#> [1] "An analyte Etramp4_ag1 did not reach the specified count in the given sample"
#> 
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [[2]][[1]]
#> [1] "An analyte Etramp4_ag1 did not reach the specified count in the given sample"
    plate$get_sample(1)$warnings
    #> list()
    plate$get(analyte = "AMA1", sample = 1)
    #>        AMA1
#> Median   23
#> Count   143
    plate$get_sample_by_type("POSITIVE CONTROL")[[1]]$warnings
    #> [[1]]
#> [1] "An analyte Etramp4_ag1 did not reach the specified count in the given sample"

    simple standard curve plotting 

    plot_standard_curve_antibody(plate, antibody_name = "AMA1")
    #> (WARNING)
#> Blank values not adjusted - Consider adjusting the blank values using function `plate$blank_adjustment`
#> (WARNING)
#> No standard curve samples found in the plate
#> Using positive control samples

    plate$blank_adjustment()

plot_standard_curve_antibody(plate, antibody_name = "AMA1")
    #> (WARNING)
#> No standard curve samples found in the plate
#> Using positive control samples
